SENT.plain: A case of pseudotumour cerebri (PTC) in a 13-year-old girl is reported
This patient experienced menarche seven months before presentation, and subsequently developed acne which necessitated antibiotic therapy
She had been treated with minocycline hydrochloride (100 mg twice a day) for two months before admission to hospital
The role of minocycline therapy associated with menarche in the aetiology of PTC is discussed
